title: Ferrari SF90 Stradale
description: Ferrari's first series-production PHEV hypercar, delivering 1000 hp by combining a twin-turbo V8 with three electric motors. The pinnacle of modern performance.

title: Ferrari 296 GTB
description: Marking the return of the V6 engine to a Ferrari road car, this plug-in hybrid is celebrated for its agile handling and exhilarating 'piccolo V12' sound.

title: Ferrari Purosangue
description: Ferrari's first-ever four-door, four-seater. Not an SUV, but a true Ferrari with a naturally-aspirated V12, offering unprecedented space and versatility.

title: Ferrari LaFerrari
description: The successor to the Enzo and a member of the hypercar 'Holy Trinity'. A limited-production masterpiece featuring an F1-derived HY-KERS hybrid V12 system.

title: Ferrari F40
description: The last car personally approved by Enzo Ferrari. A raw, uncompromising, and iconic supercar known for its twin-turbo V8 and pure, analogue driving experience.

title: Ferrari Enzo
description: A defining hypercar of the 2000s, named after the company's founder. It brought Formula 1 technology, including a carbon fiber chassis, to the road.

title: Ferrari 812 Competizione
description: The track-focused, hardcore evolution of the 812 Superfast. Features the highest-revving Ferrari V12 ever, with extreme aerodynamics for ultimate performance.

title: Ferrari Roma
description: Embodying 'La Nuova Dolce Vita', the Roma is an elegant front-engine GT coupe that combines timeless design with modern performance for sophisticated grand touring.

title: Ferrari F8 Tributo
description: A tribute to Ferrari's most powerful V8 engine. This mid-engine berlinetta is the successor to the 488, known for its immense power and accessible handling.

title: Ferrari 488 Pista
description: The track-oriented 'Pista' version of the 488 GTB. A lighter, more powerful, and aerodynamically advanced machine built for maximum performance.
